001package edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.controller;
002
003import static java.lang.System.currentTimeMillis;
004
005import android.os.Bundle;
006import android.text.Editable;
007import android.text.TextWatcher;
008import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
009import androidx.annotation.Nullable;
010import androidx.fragment.app.Fragment;
011import android.view.LayoutInflater;
012import android.view.View;
013import android.view.ViewGroup;
014import androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner;
015import androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelProvider;
016import androidx.navigation.NavController;
017import androidx.navigation.Navigation;
018import dagger.hilt.android.AndroidEntryPoint;
019import edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.databinding.FragmentAlarmWarningBinding;
020import edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.util.PasswordWatcher;
021import edu.cnm.deepdive.leavemealone.viewmodel.AlertViewModel;
022
023/**
024 * A simple {@link Fragment} subclass. Use the {@link AlarmWarningFragment#newInstance} factory
025 * method to create an instance of this fragment.
026 */
027@AndroidEntryPoint
028public class AlarmWarningFragment extends Fragment {
029
030  public static final int PASSWORD_DIGIT_LENGTH = 4;
031  public static final int RESET_CODE_LENGTH = 0;
032  private FragmentAlarmWarningBinding binding;
033  private AlertViewModel viewModel;
034  private int codeLength;
035
036  public AlarmWarningFragment() {
037    // Required empty public constructor
038  }
039
040  @Override
041  public View onCreateView(
042      LayoutInflater inflater, ViewGroup container, Bundle savedInstanceState) {
043    binding = FragmentAlarmWarningBinding.inflate(inflater, container, false);
044    return binding.getRoot();
045  }
046
047  /**
048   *  If this fragment has been inflated, Motion was detected and the countdown timer is
049   *  started.  The time remaining is displayed.  If the time expires, the fragment navigates
050   *  to the alarm sounding fragment
051   *  The text listener is used to determine if a password of proper length has been entered.
052   *  if so, the password is sent down to be checked
053   * @param view
054   * @param savedInstanceState
055   */
056  @Override
057  public void onViewCreated(@NonNull View view, @Nullable Bundle savedInstanceState) {
058    super.onViewCreated(view, savedInstanceState);
059    NavController navController = Navigation.findNavController(view);
060    ViewModelProvider provider = new ViewModelProvider(this);
061    viewModel = provider.get(AlertViewModel.class);
062    getLifecycle().addObserver(viewModel);
063    LifecycleOwner owner = getViewLifecycleOwner();
064    viewModel.startTimer();
065    viewModel.getTimeRemaining()
066        .observe(owner, (time) -> binding.countdown.setText(String.valueOf(time)));
067    viewModel.getTimeExpired()
068        .observe(owner, (expired) -> {
069          if (expired) {
070            navController.navigate(ControlsFragmentDirections.navigateSounding());
071          }
072        });
073    binding.textCode.addTextChangedListener((PasswordWatcher) s -> {
074      codeLength++;
075      if (codeLength == PASSWORD_DIGIT_LENGTH) {
076        String inputCode = s.toString();
077        if(viewModel.checkPassword(inputCode)){
078          navController.navigate(AlarmArmFragmentDirections.navigateControls());
079        }
080        binding.textCode.setText("");
081        codeLength = RESET_CODE_LENGTH;
082      }
083    });
084  }
085
086  @Override
087  public void onDestroyView() {
088    binding = null;
089    super.onDestroyView();
090  }
091
092
093}
